newsitem.title: IRAQ: Iraq's Saddam meets his air defence commanders.
newsitem.headline: Iraq's Saddam meets his air defence commanders.

text.p: President Saddam Hussein on Wednesday held a meeting with Iraqi air defence commanders, the official Iraqi News Agency (INA) reported.
INA said the meeting included the commander of Iraq's air defence and chiefs of staff. It gave no further detail.
Saddam urged his anti-aircraft gunners and air force pilots to hit back at U.S., British and French planes policing two no- fly zones in his country - one in the north and the other in the south.

The United States has mounted two missile strikes on Iraqi air defence positions in southern Iraq since Tuesday to neutralise possible Iraqi resistance to President Bill Clinton's decision on Tuesday to extend the southern air-exclusion zone.
